data.title: Silicon Graphics' Name Is Now SGI
data.meta_description: Silicon Graphics Inc, in branding strategy to reposition itself as diversified company for graphics, servers and supercomputers, introduces new corporate identity as SGI (S)
data.text:
In a branding strategy to reposition itself as a diversified company for graphics, servers and supercomputers, Silicon Graphics Inc. introduced a new corporate identity today as SGI

The company, which created the dinosaurs in the film ''Jurassic Park,'' is attempting to move away from its image as a niche-oriented, high-performance 3D graphics work station provider and establish itself in the technical computing market, reflecting a greater breadth and depth of products and services.

Landor Associates, the global branding consultants, assisted in the new corporate identity strategy. SGI said it generated about 50 percent of its product revenue from its servers and supercomputers.

Under the new system, the company's products will be separated into three primary sub-brands under the SGI master brand umbrella. The three sub-brands include SGI servers and services, Silicon Graphics visual work stations and Cray supercomputers.
